content: these socks are named for sabrina carpenter s espresso because the baby blue matches the baby blue aesthetic from espresso these socks are knit from the cuff down with a 2x2 ribbed cuff a shadow wrap heel and stranded colorwork the toe is finished with kitchener stitch background picture is actually my emails i can t send tour t shirt sample the sample was knit with magic loop size 2 sample used approximately 35 g/162 yd slate blue base color and 30 g/139 yd baby blue contract color sizing 1 2 3 to fit foot circumference of 8 9 10 75 inches recommended 1 inch of negative ease note if you are in between sizes you can try the larger of what you re between and sizing down your needles to 2 25 mm for the entire sock materials fingering weight sock yarn sample used knit picks stroll fingering in blue steel heather and frost gauge 36 sts x 38 rnds needles for ribbing 2 25 mm/us 1 note 2 5 mm can be used but the cuff will be looser for heel leg and toe 2 5 mm/us 1 5 techniques and tricks when knitting colorwork be consistent through the socks on which color is dominant the dominant color should be floated below the background color sample sock has cc as the dominant color for more information on color dominance https //paper-tiger net/2013/11/09/stranded-knitting-the-importance-of-color-dominance/ *note* - this pattern was not tech edited or test knit if you notice any issues with the pattern please feel free to reach out to me so i can correct them thank you
